ctDhcpAdminStatus.name: ctDhcpAdminStatus
ctDhcpAdminStatus.description: This object is used to enable or disable the DHCP server function for the entire device. This object must be set to enabled for the server to function on this device.

ctDhcpOperStatus.name: ctDhcpOperStatus
ctDhcpOperStatus.description: Indicates the current operating status of the DHCP server function on this device. The value of ctDhcpIfOperStatus for at least one interface must be set to enabled for this object to be enabled.

ctDhcpDiscovers.name: ctDhcpDiscovers
ctDhcpDiscovers.description: This value is the number of discover messages received by the DHCP server since the last reset.

ctDhcpOffers.name: ctDhcpOffers
ctDhcpOffers.description: This value is the number of offer messages sent by the DHCP server since the last reset.

ctDhcpRequests.name: ctDhcpRequests
ctDhcpRequests.description: This value is the number of request messages received by the DHCP server since the last reset.

ctDhcpDeclines.name: ctDhcpDeclines
ctDhcpDeclines.description: This value is the number of decline messages received by the DHCP server since the last reset.

ctDhcpReleases.name: ctDhcpReleases
ctDhcpReleases.description: This value is the number of release messages received by the DHCP server since the last reset.

ctDhcpAcks.name: ctDhcpAcks
ctDhcpAcks.description: This value is the number of ack messages sent by the DHCP server since the last reset.

ctDhcpNaks.name: ctDhcpNaks
ctDhcpNaks.description: This value is the number of nak messages sent by the DHCP server since the last reset.

ctDhcpOtherServers.name: ctDhcpOtherServers
ctDhcpOtherServers.description: This value is the number of messages received by the DHCP server since the last reset which were directed to other servers.

ctDhcpProtocolErrors.name: ctDhcpProtocolErrors
ctDhcpProtocolErrors.description: This value is the number of protocol errors detected by the DHCP server since the last reset.

ctDhcpServerTime.name: ctDhcpServerTime
ctDhcpServerTime.description: This value is the number of seconds that this DHCP server has been in operation since its non-volatile memory was last cleared.

ctDhcpNoOfActiveClients.name: ctDhcpNoOfActiveClients
ctDhcpNoOfActiveClients.description: This value is the number of clients who currently have network addresses assigned by this DHCP server.

ctDhcpReclaimIP.name: ctDhcpReclaimIP
ctDhcpReclaimIP.description: This object is a method of reclaiming abandoned IP addresses. The value reads as 0.0.0.0. Writing to it with an IP address of a client on the active list will remove the entry from the list. It is used to recover addresses with long leases from clients who have left the network without sending a release notice.

ctDhcpServerIfTable.name: ctDhcpServerIfTable
ctDhcpServerIfTable.description: This table contains an entry for each port of a DHCP server which is eligible to perform DHCP functions. The table is indexed by ctDhcpIfIndex, which indicates the value of the MIB 2 ifindex which identifies the device's interface for which the entry exists.

ctDhcpServerIfEntry.name: ctDhcpServerIfEntry
ctDhcpServerIfEntry.description: A description of the configuration parameters for a single interface on the DHCP server.

ctDhcpIfIndex.name: ctDhcpIfIndex
ctDhcpIfIndex.description: A unique value identifying an element in a sequence of entries which belong to the DHCP server interface list. This value ranges from 1 to 2.

ctDhcpIfAdminStatus.name: ctDhcpIfAdminStatus
ctDhcpIfAdminStatus.description: Used to enable and disable the DHCP functions on this interface only. This object must be set to enabled for the DHCP functions to occur on this interface.

ctDhcpIfOperStatus.name: ctDhcpIfOperStatus
ctDhcpIfOperStatus.description: Indicates the current operating status of the DHCP server function on this interface.

ctDhcpIfServerAddress.name: ctDhcpIfServerAddress
ctDhcpIfServerAddress.description: This is the IP address of the interface which is providing access to the DHCP server for clients which are connected to this network.

ctDhcpIfNetworkAddress.name: ctDhcpIfNetworkAddress
ctDhcpIfNetworkAddress.description: This is the IP subnet which is being served by this interface of the DHCP server.

ctDhcpIfSubnetMask.name: ctDhcpIfSubnetMask
ctDhcpIfSubnetMask.description: This is the subnet mask of the IP subnet which is being served by this interface of the DHCP server.

ctDhcpIfLowestaddress.name: ctDhcpIfLowestaddress
ctDhcpIfLowestaddress.description: This is the lowest numerical value of the IP address range that will be assigned to clients by this interface of the DHCP server. Its value must be greater or equal to ctDhcpIfNetworkAddress and less than or equal to ctDhcpIfHighestAddress.

ctDhcpIfHighestAddress.name: ctDhcpIfHighestAddress
ctDhcpIfHighestAddress.description: This is the highest numerical value of the IP address range that will be assigned to clients by this interface of the DHCP server. Its value must be greater or equal to ctDhcpIfLowestaddress but remain within ctDhcpIfNetworkAddress.

ctDhcpIfAddressesUsed.name: ctDhcpIfAddressesUsed
ctDhcpIfAddressesUsed.description: This value is the number of clients which are currently using IP addresses assigned by this interface of the DHCP server.

ctDhcpIfAddressesFree.name: ctDhcpIfAddressesFree
ctDhcpIfAddressesFree.description: This value is the number of IP addresses that are currently available for distribution by this interface of the DHCP server.

ctDhcpIfLeasePeriod.name: ctDhcpIfLeasePeriod
ctDhcpIfLeasePeriod.description: This value is the time period for which an IP address assigned by this interface is valid. The units are seconds. A value of 0 signifys that the lease will never expire.

ctDhcpIfDefaultGateway.name: ctDhcpIfDefaultGateway
ctDhcpIfDefaultGateway.description: This value is an DHCP option that can be passed to a client by this interface if it is requested as part of the DHCP process. This value is the IP address of the default gateway to be used by the client.

ctDhcpIfDomainNameServer.name: ctDhcpIfDomainNameServer
ctDhcpIfDomainNameServer.description: This value is an DHCP option that can be passed to a client by this interface if it is requested as part of the DHCP process. This value is the IP address of the domain name server to be used by the client.

ctDhcpIfDomainName.name: ctDhcpIfDomainName
ctDhcpIfDomainName.description: This value is an DHCP option that can be passed to a client by this interface if it is requested as part of the DHCP process. This value is the domain name to be used by the client.

ctDhcpIfWINServer.name: ctDhcpIfWINServer
ctDhcpIfWINServer.description: This value is an DHCP option that can be passed to a client by this interface if it is requested as part of the DHCP process. This value is the IP address of the NetBIOS overTCP/IP name server to be used by the client.

ctDhcpClientStatsTable.name: ctDhcpClientStatsTable
ctDhcpClientStatsTable.description: This table contains an entry for each DHCP client. The table is indexed by ctDhcpClientStatsID, which indicates an arbitrary order of entries.

ctDhcpClientStatsEntry.name: ctDhcpClientStatsEntry
ctDhcpClientStatsEntry.description: A description of a single client, which could be on any of the subnets being served by participating interfaces.

ctDhcpClientStatsID.name: ctDhcpClientStatsID
ctDhcpClientStatsID.description: A unique value identifying an element in a sequence of active clients which have been given network addresses by this DHCP server.

ctDhcpClientName.name: ctDhcpClientName
ctDhcpClientName.description: This is the name of the client as listed by the client in a DHCP request packet.

ctDhcpClientIP.name: ctDhcpClientIP
ctDhcpClientIP.description: This is the assigned IP address of the client during this active connection.

ctDhcpClientID.name: ctDhcpClientID
ctDhcpClientID.description: This is the ID of the client as listed by the client in a DHCP request packet. It is normally the client's Ethernet MAC address.

ctDhcpEndOfLease.name: ctDhcpEndOfLease
ctDhcpEndOfLease.description: This value is the time at which the lease of the IP address will expire. The units are seconds and the value is relative to the same starting point as ctDhcpIfServerTime.
